author: Special Correspondent
text:
A seminar held in connection with the International Women’s Day celebrations urged the government to enact special legislation to put an end to honour killings in the country.

A resolution to this effect was adopted at the seminar brought up jointly by the All India Democratic Women’s Association (AIDWA), National Federation of Indian Women (NFIW) and Tamil Nadu Women’s Association here recently.

The resolution said that honour killings proved a disgrace to the entire society.

Another resolution made a forceful plea for the introduction of total prohibition in the state.

The seminar also took exception to the steep increase in the prices of essential commodities and urged both the Centre and the State Government to take effective steps for checking the same.

Reservation for women should be ensured in Parliament and State legislatures, another resolution demanded.

S. Laventina, state president, AIDWA, K. Jothilakhmi, its state secretary, P. Padmavathi, state secretary of the NFIW, R. Vasantha Rathinavel, its former state secretary, R. Arokiya Mary, state president of the Tamil Nadu Women’s Association, and others spoke exhorting the women to establish their rights at all costs.
title: ‘Honour killing disgrace to society’
